meanings.definition: A curved weapon for shooting arrows.
meanings.sent1: The archer aimed the bowe at the target.
meanings.sent2: He always carries his bowe when he goes hunting.
meanings.sent3: The bowe looked like a magical tool in the archer's hands.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a sharp bowe, ready to strike at any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The bowe gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of skill and precision.

meanings.definition: To bend the head or upper part of the body as a sign of respect or greeting.
meanings.sent1: He will bowe to the king when he enters the room.
meanings.sent2: It is polite to bowe when meeting someone for the first time.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to bowe to the fish before eating it.
meanings.sent4: The trees seemed to bowe in the wind's powerful embrace.
meanings.sent5: She would bowe gracefully, showing her respect and humility.

meanings.definition: A knot tied with two loops and two loose ends.
meanings.sent1: She secured the package with a tight bowe.
meanings.sent2: The bowe in the rope kept everything in place.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tied a bowe in the shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: The bowe in the ribbon added a touch of elegance to the gift.
meanings.sent5: He carefully untied the bowe, revealing the surprise inside.
